column1: fuller outside off and swinging away, left alone by Zazai
length outside off, cuts it between cover and point this time, gets a couple
fuller around off, and defended towards cover
length on off, fends to cover-point from the front foot
an outswinger from Cotrell, Zazai plays and misses on the front foot
back of a length, inswing, thuds on the pad, minimal footwork
length ball that nips away from outside off, left alone
beauty! This one squares him up to whizz past the outside edge
length on off, fends to point with open face
back of a length on off, fends to point
full and around off, defended with soft hands
good leave to a length ball that jags away from the fourth stump
fuller outside off, goes for the drive but is not exactly to the pitch of the ball, was in the air for a while but well short of the mid-off fielder
length outside off, pushes his bat at it and gets beaten
length outside off once more, looks for a big booming drive over mid-off, gets beaten
length outside off, Zazai is trying to remove leather off the ball but gets beaten again
length outside off, looks to defend this time but the ball shapes away from him
length ball, much closer to the batsman this time, Zazai works it towards mid-on for a quick single
length ball angling in, taps it towards square leg
fuller and wider outside off, looks to drive through covers, makes no contact
length ball at the stumps, goes for the pull and is beaten again, gets hit on the body
length ball around off, looks to chip it over mid-off but doesn't get hold of it. Ends up skying over cover, Hetmyer runs backwards, puts in the dive but fails to latch on to
length ball around off, defended from the crease
length outside off, goes for the pull and misses
fuller and angling away from the batsman, mistimes the drive towards extra cover
a yorker at the leg stump, jams his bat at it to get a single in front of square leg, off the mark
length outside off, goes for the cut, ends up chopping it towards covers
fuller and down the leg side, Zazai goes for the flick but cannot connect, called a wide
length ball around off, Zazai slaps it back towards the right of the bowler who tumbles but cannot get a hand to it
Cottrell has the last laugh, a superb yorker at the leg stump, and the stick is out of the ground, cartwheeling towards the keeper, and there's customary salute celebration from the fast bowler
length ball in the channel, left alone by Shah
length outside off, enough room to free arms and Ahmadi cuts it between cover and point for four
length ball, much closer to the stumps this time, left alone by the batsman
length ball outside off, dabs it towards cover from the crease
length ball outside off, Ahmadi once again goes for the cut, too close this time though, chops it down into the ground
slashes at this length ball outside off and gets an outside off, a sharp chance and Pooran at second slip grab it nicely with fingers pointing upwards. Both openers are back in the pavilion
length ball outside off, just around that fourth stump line, looks to defend and gets beaten
fuller on the stumps, driven back towards the bowler
short of length at the batsman, Rahmat rises on his toes and drops it down
fuller outside off, driven off the back foot towards the left of the point fielder who puts in the dive but cannot stop it, third man moves across to keep it to two, Rahmat is off the mark
beaten! A length ball around fourth stump and Rahmat was looking to defend at it, gets beaten as the ball keeps moving away with the angle
length ball, on the stumps this time, defended from the front foot
fuller outside off, pushes it through covers, finds the gap and the outfield does the rest, the ball just keeps going away from the chasing Walsh
length ball in the corridor, left alone
length outside off, good bounce there for Holder. Shouldered arms once again
a touch fuller and closer this time, Alikhil comes forward and defends it towards mid-off
fuller outside off, plays towards gully with an angled bat, a tumbling stop there keeps Alikhil on strike
length ball on the stumps, looks to come forward but ends up defending it back towards Holder
length around off, drops it towards the right of extra cover and sets off for a quick single
short of length outside off, pushes away from the body, was in the air but well away from the diving point to his left. Comes back for the second
another short one, this time near the rib cage. Gets Alikhil hopping who fends it behind square leg
length ball down the leg side, called a wide
short of length outside off, drops it down towards the slip region
length ball at the stumps, bunts on the leg side
short of length outside off, drops it on the off side from the back foot
length ball on the pads, flicked towards square leg but fails to find the gap
fuller and wider outside off, chases it with hard hands, gets beaten
length outside off, left alonehttp://www.espncricinfo.com/westindies/content/player/53264.html
length ball on the stumps, Alikhil looks to flick it away but gets himself in a tangle and is wrapped on the pads, an appeal for lbw but given not out. Looked very close to me
length outside off and moving away, Alikhil chases it with his hands and misses
short of length around off, stays back and pushes it towards cover
short of length at the batsman, no room at all, defended on the off side
short of length outside off, dabs it down towards third man
short of length outside off, pushes it into covers from the back foot
a bouncer from Joseph, aimed at the batsman but Alikhil ducks under it comfortably although the bat was pointing upwards like a periscope
short and this doesn't rise that much, Alikhil pulls it towards the deep square leg boundary
another short one and another pull, not in complete control this time, takes his eyes off at the last moment as he makes the contact. Gets it behind square leg but the fine leg fielder had no chance
beaten! Short of length outside off, hangs his bat out but luckily no edge there
length ball in the corridor, left alone
length again, further away from the batsman, Rahmat lets it go through
a touch fuller and straighter, Rahmat drives it towards mid-off where Shepherd throws himself to his right to make a partial stop
length around off, defended from the front foot
fuller around off, comes forward and drives firmly but Holder stops it in his followthrough
length outside off, chops it towards covers from the crease
length outside off, pushes away from the gets and gets it behind point for one
length ball around middle and leg, defended towards square leg
a touch fuller outside off, driven handsomely from the front foot, finds the gap at extra cover and the outfield does the rest
short of length around off, drops it on the off side and sneaks in a quick single
length ball around off, taps it towards backward point without much feet movement

a thick outside edge but beats the man at gully to his right. Was fuller and wider, Alikhil went for the drive but failed make a neat connection, the gully fielder dived to his right but the ball just beats him
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-off
length ball around off and moving slightly away, good bounce as well. Rahmat looks to defend but gets beaten
short of length outside off, cuts hard but a good stop by Walsh at backward point, throwing himself to his left
fuller on the stumps and driven but Shepherd does well to get low in his followthrough and make the stop
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg
length ball outside off, looks to defend and gets beaten
full outswinger just outside off, driven to cover
short and wide outside off, cut firmly to sweeper cover
straightens a length ball on middle, defended solidly
stands tall and bunts this to point
floats this full and outside off, Ikram gets a good stride in as he lets it go
tucks this to square leg, the midwicket fielder was having an afternoon snooze and they easily completed the second. The man at deep square had to run in a long way
driven confidently on the up, a half-stop at mid-off from Alzarri keeps it to a single
hint of width outside off, punched to point
swivels back and pulls him uppishly to deep square leg
short of length, rides the bounce nicely to keep that out
driven firmly on the up to extra cover
timed well as he punches off the backfoot but straight to point
drilled down the ground! Cottrell bowls too full and Ikram takes full toll of that
skiddy short ball, he plays the short arm jab to deep midwicket
beauty! Looks to run it down to third man but is beaten by the angle, too close
solidly defended from the crease to point

tapped into the gap between point and gully, the throw at the striker's end is a wayward one, but Ikram was way past the stumps and had to run back nearly 40 yards to complete the second. May have completed three had he not run that far.
firm push into the covers, Pollard with the stop
flayed on the up to sweeper cover
tucks this gently to square leg for a single
cut away but point gets a half-stop in, parries it to square third man

he's given this an almighty heave and gets enough bat to clear mid-on, trickles to the ropes slowly. Got more elevation than distance but there was no fielder near the ball. It was predetermined. Afghanistan looking to inject momentum
swivels nicely and pulls into the gap between deep square and deep fine leg
arches back and dabs this away nicely past the cordon to third man
tossed up outside off, defended back
drifting into the pads, looks to flick but can't bat to it, rolls off the pad to short square leg
eased back to the bowler with the spin
drifts in and slides with the angle, he gets well forward and defends
sharp turn, square turn. Bounce too. Ikram squared up comprehensively
driven with the spin to sweeper cover
pulled away to deep square. Another short ball in the mid 130s from Shepherd
super hit! Clears his front leg and swats this back over the bowler's head. Lands in front of the sightscreen. Terrific hit
rolls his wrists nicely over the ball and pulls this down to fine leg
takes him on again with the pull, hit well to deep square
helps this along to fine leg, this was short and angling in
ducks under this short ball as Shepherd bangs one in from around the stumps to tuck him up
looks to drive, gets it to the bowler off a thickish inside edge
swept with the spin, no one behind square and it bounces to the fence at deep square
gets outside the line and defends with soft hands
steps out and works this to mid-on, excellent stop by the skipper
attempts a cute paddle, doesn't get enough bat on it, straight to short fine leg
driven through to long-off
width outside off, punches to backward point
uppish but hit well behind point, down to Cottrell at square third man
top-edged for six! It's the extra pace and bounce that helps Ikram as he plays an impulsive pull. The ball got big on him, flew off the blade.
clobbered across the line to the midwicket fence! This is a super hit, predetermined again but the timing was sublime
length on the pads, tucks this to deep square. Brings up his half-century, his 2nd against West Indies. Has given a decent crowd plenty to cheer in the last half hour
beaten as he looks to force this through cover point, cramped for room

beautiful delivery, drew him forward and got this to spin past the outside edge with some late dip. The third umpire has been called in to check for a stumping but no one's really celebrating. The back foot was well inside the crease when the bails came off. Not out it is. Shai Hope took a while to whip the bails off. Who knows, it may have been a different story had MS Dhoni been there
plays inside the line as he lunges forward to defend, spins past the edge. Cracking delivery
forced into the gap at cover
gets well forward and dabs this towards point for a quick single
works this with the drift and angle towards wide long-on
paddled past short fine, fine leg comes around to cut that off
defended from the crease
squirted over cover point, down to the boundary rider
too full, too straight and he's scorched this back past the bowler. What power and timing!
tucks this into the gap at midwicket, sensible
defends with an angled bat to point
on the pads, worked to deep square. Raises the century stand
superb delivery, spun past the face of the bat as it drifted in
squeezed back to the bowler
works this past short midwicket for an easy single
sharp turn, spins down leg, good grab by the keeper
sharp turn again, shapes to cut but is cramped for room, hit on the thigh pad
gets outside the line of the stumps and smothers this
struck on the pad, big appeal but struck outside the line
sharp turn from outside off, bunted wide of cover
lunges forward and defends this tossed up delivery back
cuts and cuts well, beats backward point. Lovely touch from Rahmat, waited, waited and placed it superbly
gets forward and dabs it to point for a quick single
pulled all along the ground to deep midwicket
steps out and bunts it to cover point
struck outside the line as he looks to sweep
bunts to short third, quick single scampered

uppish but wide of short midwicket as Rahmat raises fifty. Well, well, forget the fifty, there may be a wicket here. West Indies have appealed for a run out. Ikram grounded his bat at the striker's end, but dragged his bat out and walked, seemingly to congratulate Rahmat Shah for his fifty. Maybe he believed the ball was dead? It wasn't, and even though he didn't mean to steal a second run, he has to walk back. Well within the rules, West Indies have nothing to be ashamed about for appealing. Ikram will learn, for now he will be fuming at having given West Indies some leeway as this partnership threatened.
sharp turn from outside off, left alone
defended from the crease
edged and taken! Sharp turn to draw him forward, enough turn to get the edge and Holder takes a good, low catch at slip. One brings two as they say. Afghanistan rocked by this double-strike!
short and wide, he thumps this to sweeper cover
driven straight to cover
squirts this tossed up delivery back to the bowler
sharp turn, bounce to beat his forward push. Superb delivery
cut away but can't find the gap, straight to point
whips this down to long-on
turns this to the leg side
worked to short midwicket again
struck outside the line as he attempts a slog sweep, rolls to short third man and they scamper a leg bye
attempts a scoop, beaten. Wandered out of the crease but had the presence of mind to drag his bat back as the keeper tried to recover from the fumble and hit the stumps
uppish but worked into the gap at square leg, misfield from the man coming in from the deep allows them to get the second
tucks this wide of square leg for an easy single
rocks back and cuts to point
touch short, slapped to point again
eased with the turn to point
lunges forward and bunts it to the off side
driven hard to cover
eased to long-off
length ball around off and middle, flicked towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, skips down and drives it towards long-on
length ball around off, stays back and flicks it towards square leg
fuller around off, sweeps it towards square leg but cannot beat the man
length around off, some extra bounce there, goes back and works it towards short fine leg
length ball but spinning down the leg side, Rahmat looks to flick but misses, called a wide
length ball on the stumps, flicks it towards square leg
a dipping full toss outside off, sweeps it towards square leg where the fielders lets it through his hands
fuller around off, drives it towards extra cover
fuller outside off, goes for the sweep but the ball spins away from the batsman
fuller around off, skips down the track and makes a neat connection this time, over the bowler's head for a maximum
fuller around off, looks to drive through the off sides but the ball takes the inner half and rolls towards short midwicket
a full toss around off, drives it towards long-off
length ball around off and spinning in, looks to defend on the front foot, the ball takes the outside edge and beats the keeper on his right, who was moving in the other direction
fuller around off and middle, uses his feet to drive it towards long-on
a soft dismissal for Rahmat. Was a length ball outside off, looks to scoop it away but ends up lobbing to Holder at square leg. A dolly for the fielder
fuller around off, looks to defend but it spins in sharply. Appeal for lbw but would have gone on to miss the leg stump
pushed towards covers
length ball around off, lunges forward and blocks
length ball around off, dabs it behind square leg. A bit of a fumble there by Hetmyer allows the second run
short of length around off, dabs it behind square leg for one
length ball around off, stays back and defends it towards cover
short of length around off, stays back and dabs it towards square leg
fuller around off, stays in his crease and offers the forward defence
short of length outside off, sways away from the line of the ball
length ball around off, comes forward and defends
length ball outside off, sweeps it behind square leg
length ball spinning in, goes back and helps it towards square leg
length ball outside off, steers it towards backward point
fuller outside off, drives it towards mid-off
length ball, spinning down the leg side. A big wide
flatter and quicker around off, defends it behind square leg
short of length outside off, looks to open the face and run it towards third man, fails to connect
length ball around off, stays back and blocks
length ball angling in, Nabi skips down and looks to hoick it on the leg side. Gets an outside edge that flies to third man. Cottrell grabs it comfortably
fuller around off, a thick outside edge to the left of the gully fielder
short of length around off, rises with the bounce and drops it on the off side
short of length angling in, pulls it behind square leg and into the ground
length ball around off and spinning in, looks to flick but misses. The ball lobs towards short fine leg off the pad
length ball down the leg side, helps it towards fine leg
fuller around off, comes forward and smothers it
length ball around off and middle, looks to work on the leg side but misses and is hit on the pads
fuller around off, comes forward and works it towards square leg
length ball around off, stays back and defends
length ball on middle and leg, dabs it towards square leg
length ball around off, looks to flick, gets an inside edge onto the pads
short of length, rising towards the batsman who drops it on the leg side
length ball around middle and leg, flicked behind square leg for a brace. Great running by Asghar
length ball around off, stays back and defends
short of length around off, goes back and pulls it towards square leg
length ball around off, stays back and tucks it behind square leg
length ball around off, taps it towards backward point where Walsh Jr makes a diving stop to save a run for his side
fuller around off, comes forward and defends towards mid-off
short, hurried at the batsman, Naib goes for the pull but gets a top edge that sails over the keeper
length ball on the leg stump, tucked away towards backward square leg
short of length outside off and pulled away firmly but couldn't beat the man at short midwicket
length ball around off, pushes it towards point
length ball on the stumps, turned away towards square leg
length ball around off, pushes it towards covers
a yorker but just outside off, Asghar looks to jam his bat at it but gets beaten
short of length, pulled away behind square leg, a sliding stop by Hetmyer near the boundary but the ball was still rolling towards the rope. Chase does well to stop it just inside
length ball around off, punched off the back foot towards extra cover
length ball outside off, Asghar looks to sweep but misses as the spins away
length ball around off, goes back to defend but misses again as the ball spins away
a touch short this time, works it towards square leg
dropped short and Naib doesn't miss out. Rocks back and pulls it towards deep midwicket, finds the gap and gets a boundary. One-bounce four
flatter around off, stays back and steers it towards backward point
length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
short of length outside off, pulls away, perhaps not in the desired direction but it runs to the left of the mid-on fielder for four
short of length outside off, the nataraj pull past Pollard at short midwicket for one
length outside off, drives from the back foot but cannot beat the cover fielder
length ball outside off, pushes it towards cover
another short one, a tennis-forehand like pull towards short midwicket, Pollard there
short of length around off, works it towards square leg
fuller around off, goes for the sweep but ends up playing over the ball. Was a googly and hits the batsman near abdomen
length ball outside off, sweeps it towards deep square leg. Lewis makes a sliding stop to his right
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards long-off
fuller around off, driven but straight to extra cover

too full and Naib goes for a big hit. Looks to clear long-off but doesn't get the elevation and Chase takes a low catch after coming in a couple of steps. Walsh has his first ODI wicket for West Indies
flat and short outside off but Rashid ends up hitting it towards the bowler only
short of length outside off, cuts it towards deep point
length outside off, pushes at it and gets a faint outside edge. A regulation catch for Hope, a duck for Rashid and a maiden ODI wicket for Shepherd
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball outside off, drops it towards point
short of length outside off, Naveen lets it go through to the keeper
length outside off, left alone
fuller around off, pushes it towards cover-point
length ball outside off, pushes it towards cover and gets to the other end
a googly from Walsh, pitching on middle and spinning into the batsman to hit on the thigh, was going down
a sharp legbreak outside off, pushes at it and gets beaten. Hope breaks the stumps but Naveen's foot was always inside and grounded
short of length and pulled away towards deep-backward square leg

fuller outside off, pushes at it, gets an outside edge into the ground and towards the right of Holder at slip. Looks to sneak in a single but Holder gets low and flicks it on to the stumps. Hope shows great presence of mind and lets the ball hit the stumps directly. Afghan tries to get back but is too late
length ball around off, defends it from the crease
short of length outside off, goes for the pull but ends up skying towards the non-striker. Pollard moves from short midwicket, calls early and pouches it with those buckets
nice and full on the stumps, defended
skids one past the outside edge. Hope plays for turn but there is none.
length ball sliding into middle and leg, tucked to the leg side
beauty! Deviates away to square him up and whizz past the edge
rocks back and pulls to deep square, excellent work by Naveen Ul Haq. Wayward delivery
works this wide of midwicket for an easy single
nice and full on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
back of length outside off, defended solidly
laces this back down the pitch using the full face of the bat
bowls this wide outside off, there for the cut but this has been left alone
overbalanced as he looks to flick, misses. But the ball was sliding down too, wide called.
shapes to drive, gets a thick inside edge to mid-on and they complete a risky single
right besides the line as he defends this length ball
googly that lands on a length outside off, defended
skids one back in, hit on the thigh pad as he looks to whip this square
draws him forward and gets this to leave him late. Beaten
beaten as he looks to work it square, hit on the pad
nice and full on the stumps, kept out
bunts this to point
full and slanting away, left alone
stands tall and punches to cover point, excellent stop
misfield at cover and they'll come back for the second. Some pressure released
tucked away gently into the gap between midwicket and square leg
another misfield, this time from the skipper at mid-off. This was a firm push, what should've been a dot ball costs them three runs. Dew maybe?
gets outside the line of the stumps and defends
trapped plumb in front! Drifts one in, Lewis expects this to turn but this carrom ball skids through to hit him on the left pad as he's on the back foot. Would've crashed into middle and leg.
another skiddy length ball, pushed to midwicket
bunts to long-on and gets off the mark
goes right back into the crease and defends this fullish delivery. Loaded with risk that
appeal for lbw as he tries to play a reverse pull. Hit on the front pad, but umpire Reiffel is unmoved. Height may have been in question. May have been struck outside off too. Got into a tangle
punched to cover, top over. The squeeze is on
nice and full outside off, there for the drive, but he lets it go
nice and full, he gets outside the line and lets it go again
firmly driven, the bowler puts his right hand out to stop it on his followthrough
goes full and outside off, lets it go
gets a good stride forward to defend this
right behind the line, shows the full face of the bat to defend back
fires this in full on the stumps, defended
works this down to long-on
works it down to long-on as they jog the single
width and he's crashed that through cover. Right in the slot and this time he couldn't hold back!
stabs this away with his bat well in front of the pad
rocks back to pull, but is through with the shot early, flicks the pad and beats the keeper, short fine to the boundary. Leg byes
works this wide of midwicket
slower and fuller on the stumps, defended back
slants one into middle and leg, tucked to deep square

this is an absolute corker! Hetmyer is gone and he's out to a great ball. Angled in from around the stumps, length is super full, hits the seam and nips away. Hetmyer is looking to play this towards mid-on but doesn't account for the late movement and the ball kisses the edge through to the keeper. The Afghans are super excited and why not?
what balance, what timing. What placement. Teaser for the midwicket fielder but he wasn't going to stop that. On the pads and Chase put that away effortlessly
mistimes the cut to point
punched into the off side, mid-off runs across quickly to slide and stop
delightful cover drive! Too full, he leant forward and just caressed it into the gap
skiddy length ball drifting in, defended back
works this into the gap at deep square leg
right behind the line as he defends this length ball
punched back to the bowler
lands it on a length, pushed back to the bowler
gets well forward and turns this wrong'un into the leg side
flatter one on middle and leg, defended to the leg side
punched to cover point
has he feathered that? Looked to pull, bursts through the keeper's legs. May have been an underedge
reads the wrong'un and works this to the leg side
works this down to long-on
flatter and fuller, he covers the spin and defends
squirted to short third man
flatter length delivery on middle, defended back
lunges forward to defend, gets a leading edge that rolls back to the bowler
cut away nicely, uses the pace to lend direction to beat point and short third man
turns this gently to short midwicket
defends with the bat well in front of the pad
goes right back into the crease and defends
mix-up, mix-up but Mujeeb fumbles at short fine. This was full, flicked straight to the fielder as Hope took off for a run instinctively. Survives
gets a thick underedge on this pull, beats short fine. Races to the fence. Streaky runs
pulled nicely to deep square
punched to long-on
too full on the stumps, smothered
slips this down leg, sharp turn. Good take by the keeper
gets into a tangle trying to whip this, hit on the thigh pad
wrists this down to long-on
nice and full on the stump, defended
punched down to long-on
driven firmly to deep cover
on the pads, works this towards mid-on for a quick single
whips this into the gap between deep square and fine leg. Excellent running
once again whipped to deep square, wrong length.
plays this short-arm jab nicely to deep midwicket
flayed on the up to deep third man, sliding stop by the man at the ropes
works this with the spin to short midwicket
tucks this behind square as they jog the single
flatter one on middle and leg, he nurdles this toward deep square
works this with the spin to fine leg
flicked straight to midwicket
turned towards the man at deep midwicket
width on offer, flayed to sweeper cover
turns this to deep square leg
too short and angling into middle and leg, worked to deep square leg
right behind the line as he punches to cover
whipped to deep midwicket
width, eased on the up to deep cover
worked to square leg
works this to short midwicket
hops back and across as he defends
lunges forward and defends back
works this down to long-on
whipped uppishly, Naveen hares across the turf to cut that off
punched to deep point
chopped down to third man
slower and fuller outside off, defended from the crease
ducks under this slower bouncer outside off, there was the temptation to pull
back-of-the-hand slower ball, squared up by the length, squirted into the off side
slower and fuller on the stumps, worked to midwicket
length ball around off, punched towards short midwicket off the back foot
length again, spinning in, punched towards extra cover
length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller around off, once again some turn for Nabi, defended on the leg side
fuller around off, pushed firmly back towards the bowler
uses his feet and drives it towards long-on for one
length outside off, punched towards extra cover from back foot
slower one but short and wide, cuts it towards deep extra cover, Mujeeb moves to his right and puts in the slide to keep it to two
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards midwicket
length ball around off, dabbed towards square leg
length ball around middle and leg, flicked away in front of square leg
fuller around off, flicked away through midwicket with wrists, mid-on puts in the chase but cannot stop the boundary
length ball around off, punched towards the bowler from the back foot
short of length outside off, pulls it towards deep midwicket
was there an edge? Too full outside off, Chase looks to defend but gets beaten. The keeper fumbles and fails to latch on to. Rashid has his hands on his head
fuller on middle and leg, defended
pitched up around off, comes forward and blocks
googly. Chase was shaping up to cut it away but has to adjust and defend in the end
length ball on middle and leg, flicked behind square leg
fuller around off, Chase place back but manages to get his bat down in time and keep it away
length ball on the pads, glanced fine for a couple
length ball, spinning big into the pads, misses the flick
length on middle and spinning down, helped towards short fine leg. The keeper got some glove on it but was a tough one
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
googly outside off, Hope ends up playing inside the line and gets beaten
too full, driven towards long-off
length ball on the stumps, defended from the back foot
length ball around off, punched towards cover
a googly around off, comes forward and looks to defend. The ball dribbles towards square leg off the bat
short and pulled away but straight towards the man at deep midwicket
short again and pulled away once more. Hope goes wide of long-on and finds the gap
length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards long-on
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards square leg
length ball around off, punched towards long-on
too full this time, bunted towards short midwicket
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards long-on
length ball around off, spinning away from the batsman. Chase was looking to defend from the back foot, gets beaten
length ball around off, punched towards short midwicket
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards cover
flatter and quicker around middle and leg. Defended from the back foot
length ball around off, punched towards long-on
length ball around off, punched towards long-on
fuller around off, flicked towards short midwicket
length ball on the stumps, flicked past square leg
length ball on the stumps, waits for it before turning it towards square leg
fuller but down the leg side, Chase cannot connect the sweep but West Indies get a wide
length ball around off, Chase was looking to go back but it turns in sharply to cramp him
length ball on middle and spinning big onto the pads, Chase fails to connect the flick
a bit fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-on
fuller outside off, pushes at it and gets beaten. An appeal for caught-behind but no edge there
length ball on the stumps, goes back and forces it towards long-on
a googly around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball on middle and leg, whipped towards short fine leg

a googly on the stumps, keeps a little low as well. Flicked away towards deep midwicket, Mujeeb puts in a valiant effort, pulls it inside but it keeps rolling towards the boundary. Mujeeb is outside the boundary line but dives back in but while trying to flick it back again, his hand is on contact with the rope. And that's fifty for Shai Hope
length ball around middle and leg, flicked towards midwicket
length ball spinning in, flicked towards square leg
length ball around off, pushed towards short midwicket
length ball, punched towards the right of long-on from the back foot
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket
short of length outside off and moving away, left alone
short and wide but finds the point fielder with the cut
slower length ball, wide outside off, cuts it towards deep cover
short of length outside off, pulls it down towards deep midwicket
fuller outside off, chases a wide one but fails to connect
fuller outside off, driven firmly towards extra cover
length ball outside off, goes for the cut but cannot beat the point fielder who makes a diving stop to his left
length ball on the stumps, punched back
too full this time, digs it out towards long-off
carrom ball outside off, works it towards short third man
length around off, punched towards extra cover
length outside off, punched towards extra cover once again
short of length outside off, pulls it behind square leg
fuller around off, drives it back towards the bowler who gets a hand to it
slower one, Hope was early into the shot, ends up pushing it towards the bowler
fuller outside off, drives firmly but Rashid makes a tumbling stop to his left at mid-off
short of length outside off, pulls it behind square leg, in complete control
length outside off, cuts it behind point, third man had no chance to cut it off and that's fifty for Chase, off 69 balls
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards backward point
length ball around off, comes forward and defends
length ball around off, punched towards long-off to bring up the 100-run stand for the third wicket
fuller on the pads, clipped behind square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and whips it towards long-on
a full toss outside off, Chase fails to take advantage and ends up mistiming it towards extra cover
length ball around off, punched towards long-on
length ball, punched towards long-on for one more
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, pushes and gets beaten
length ball around off, looks to punch but gets an inside edge towards short fine leg
fuller around middle and leg, flicked towards deep midwicket
short of length, spinning in. Chase goes back and pulls it over square leg for four
short outside off, pulls again, just evading the diving short midwicket to his left. Naveen makes a sliding stop at wide long-on
length ball around off, stays back and defends
length ball around off, turns it towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards short midwicket
length ball around off, punched towards deep extra cover
length ball around off, almost squaring the batsman up. The ball rolls towards point off the outer half
punched towards long-off from the back foot
length ball on the stumps, a googly. Chase looks to flick but gets beaten. Hit high on the thigh
another googly, length outside off, Chase offers no shot. The ball hits the pad but well outside the line of the stumps and wasn't spinning back enough
third googly in a row but this time doing too much and would have missed the leg stump. Chase misses the flick
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards short midwicket
fuller on the pads, flicked towards the right of short fine leg for a quick single
short of length outside off, goes back and pulls it towards deep midwicket
length ball outside off, extra bounce and turn to cramp the batsman who was looking to go back
fuller this time, driven towards long-on
length ball, flicked towards midwicket from the back foot
googly, length ball on the stumps, punched towards short midwicket
length ball outside off, a legbreak this time and Chase shoulders arms, sending a signal that he's picking Rashid alright
length ball, punched back towards the bowler
a googly on the pads, flicked past the short fine leg
a legbreak, Chase pushes at it and gets an outside edge. Runs past the first slip fielder
too full around off and driven down the ground for a couple
fuller on the pads, clipped away behind square leg
length ball around off, works it behind square leg
length ball around off, turns it towards short midwicket

length outside off and gets an outside edge but it beats the wicketkeeper. Rashid puts in a slide near the boundary and Asghar ensures it doesn't roll on to the rope but replays show Rashid's knee was in contact with the rope when he pulled the ball inside
short of length on middle and leg, pulled away towards backward square leg
length ball around off, punched towards long-on
eased into the off side
gets well forward and defends
gets a healthy edge as he prods forward, beats short third. Streaky but they all count
fulled to deep midwicket
drops short and he flatbats this past the bowler, long-on had no chance. Umpire Reiffel deserves credit for getting out of the way in a jiffy
punched to cover
bowls full outside off, defended
gets a healthy edge, keeper can't grab. Slip fielder tries to take it on the parry but it bounces in front of him
worked into the leg side
gentle dab with soft hands to cover for a quick single, oh wait. There's an overthrow at the bowler's end and they'll get an extra run
gets well forward and smothers this
lunges forward and stabs this away
slants in a full delivery on middle, defended
firm push down the ground to mid-on
slower and fuller on the stumps from wide of the crease, he picked it out of the hand, defends
slower length ball outside off, shapes to cut but ends up defending
slants this length ball into middle and leg, defended with soft hands
bunts this gently to square third man
squared up but he manages to get behind the line and defend
prods forward, squirts off a thick inside edge to the leg side
driven firmly to cover
lunges forward and smothers it
squeezes this full delivery to midwicket
uses the pace to simply tickle this fine for a couple
short of length on middle, pulled to deep midwicket
punched on the up to sweeper cover, misfield by Ahmadi but won't cost them a second
squeezed to point, good stop by Najibullah diving to his left
looks to slap this slower delivery but played too early
delightful on-drive! Too full and he uses plenty of wrist to whip this to send it past mid-on
works this to midwicket
nice and full outside off, he gets well forward and smothers it
wrists this down to long-on
squirted to square leg
slips this down leg, beaten as he looks to whip it square. Good take by the keeper
punched to deep cover to bring Chase back on strike. He needs six for a maiden ton, WI need seven

would you believe it? Chase is gone looking for a glory hit. Saw this dropped short and looked to deposit it into the stands at deep midwicket to get his century. Instead, he sees the bails rattled as he was too early into the pull. The ball just didn't come on and his wait for a maiden ton continues. What a brilliant knock it has been nonetheless.
nearly chopped on looking to cut. Cramped for room, this one rolls to short fine leg
can't get enough bat on this attempted cut shot
pushed to cover
beaten by sharp turn as he looks to defend off the backfoot
punched back to the bowler
gets well forward and bunts this to point for a quick single
works this gently to the leg side
beaten on the pull, slower bouncer again from Gulbadin
pulled away in front of square to deep midwicket
dabs this down to third man
once again way too early into the pull, hit on the glove
slower and fuller on leg stump, tucked to where square leg would be
punches this length ball to cover
lunges forward and smothers this
works this to mid-on
there are the winning runs! Rocks back and slaps this through cover to bring up victory and a 1-0 lead in the most emphatic fashion.
